alert.note: Alert for Brewster; Presidio (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:08PM CDT until May 26 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Brewster County in southwestern Texas... Southeastern Presidio County in southwestern Texas... * Until 400 AM CDT Friday. * At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Terlingua Creek. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. Terlingua Creek will rise overnight, especially in the lower reach towards Santa Elena Canyon. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Terlingua, Study Butte and Big Bend National Park. This includes the following streams and drainages... Well Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Dark Canyon Creek, Dogie Creek, Crystal Creek, Alamo de Cesario Creek, Terlingua Creek, Dawson Creek, Goat Creek, Musgrave Creek and Grande, Rio. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
